 <h2>Browsing a HDF5 file.</h2>
HDF5 is a very general file format that permits to store data at various "semantic" or "data schema" defined by users
 <h2>Introduction</h2>
 <h2>ntuple</h2>
ioda can read ntuple (defined as a table of columns with numbers) stored at various file formats as a "flat TTree" in a CERN-ROOT file, a BINARY_TABLE in a FITS file, a flat ntuple in an AIDA file and table data in a CSV file
 Global parameters
 plot style
Since 1.2, there is the "plot style" button in the main menu that permits to change the overall style of a plot
